page.title: 01BURGHFIELD COMMON-INTRO.
page.content: This grid lies in the heart of rural Berkshire.The main settlement is Burghfield Common,which is part of the Newbury District Council area,and lies on the main road between Reading and Aldermaston, where there is a research centre.The village,which is located on a ridge about eight miles from Reading ,once consisted of only a few large houses,but was rapidly expanded in the 1950s,partly by the Ministry of Defence to house employees of the Royal Ordnance Factory at Burghfield. Further development has increased the village's importance. The grid also contains many small hamlets,such as Sulhamstead Abbots and Wokefield.Whilst Burghfield Common lies in wild heath and woodland,these hamlets are located in the nearby rich pastoral and arable farmland.
